extraction_info.note: Real health data from alternative accessible sources

sections.title: HHS Doubles AI-Backed Childhood Cancer Research Funding
content: September 30, 2025 —   Following an Executive Order by President Trump, HHS will increase funding of data-centered pediatric cancer research.

sections.title: Secretary Kennedy Swears in Dr. Anthony Letai as Director of the National Cancer Institute
content: September 29, 2025 —   Dr. Letai will serve as NCI’s 18th director.

sections.title: NIH establishes nation's first dedicated organoid development center to reduce reliance on animal modeling
content: September 25, 2025 —   The Standardized Organoid Modeling Center aims to produce standardized protocols for organoid research, addressing reproducibility challenges.

sections.title: NIH launches $50M Autism Data Science Initiative to unlock causes and improve outcomes
content: September 22, 2025 —   Funded projects will drive discoveries across biology, environment, and autism services.

sections.title: Repeated head impacts cause early neuron loss and inflammation in young athletes
content: September 17, 2025 —   NIH-funded study reveals brain changes long before chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) develops.

sections.title: NIH launches landmark project on whole-person health and function
content: September 17, 2025 —   Approach involves looking at the whole person—not just separate organs or body systems—and considering multiple factors that promote health.

sections.title: NIH launches consortium to reduce risk of stillbirth in the U.S.
content: September 16, 2025 —   More than 60% of the nearly 24,000 stillbirth cases annually remain unexplained.

sections.title: Acupuncture treatment improves disabling effects of chronic low back pain in older adults
content: September 12, 2025 —   NIH-funded study supports acupuncture needling as a safe and effective pain treatment for this group.

sections.title: Treating opioid addiction in jails improves treatment engagement, reduces overdose deaths and reincarceration
content: September 10, 2025 —   NIH-funded study demonstrates life-saving potential of providing medications for opioid use disorder in carceral settings.

sections.title: One dose of antibiotic treats early syphilis as well as three doses
content: September 3, 2025 —   NIH-funded clinical trial shows potential to simplify treatment for early syphilis.

content: HHS Doubles AI-Backed Childhood Cancer Research FundingSeptember 30, 2025 —   Following an Executive Order by President Trump, HHS will increase funding of data-centered pediatric cancer research.
Secretary Kennedy Swears in Dr. Anthony Letai as Director of the National Cancer InstituteSeptember 29, 2025 —   Dr. Letai will serve as NCI’s 18th director.

NIH establishes nation's first dedicated organoid development center to reduce reliance on animal modelingSeptember 25, 2025 —   The Standardized Organoid Modeling Center aims to produce standardized protocols for organoid research, addressing reproducibility challenges.
NIH launches $50M Autism Data Science Initiative to unlock causes and improve outcomesSeptember 22, 2025 —   Funded projects will drive discoveries across biology, environment, and autism services.

Repeated head impacts cause early neuron loss and inflammation in young athletesSeptember 17, 2025 —   NIH-funded study reveals brain changes long before chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) develops.

NIH launches landmark project on whole-person health and functionSeptember 17, 2025 —   Approach involves looking at the whole person—not just separate organs or body systems—and considering multiple factors that promote health.
NIH launches consortium to reduce risk of stillbirth in the U.S.September 16, 2025 —   More than 60% of the nearly 24,000 stillbirth cases annually remain unexplained.

Acupuncture treatment improves disabling effects of chronic low back pain in older adultsSeptember 12, 2025 —   NIH-funded study supports acupuncture needling as a safe and effective pain treatment for this group.

Treating opioid addiction in jails improves treatment engagement, reduces overdose deaths and reincarcerationSeptember 10, 2025 —   NIH-funded study demonstrates life-saving potential of providing medications for opioid use disorder in carceral settings.
One dose of antibiotic treats early syphilis as well as three dosesSeptember 3, 2025 —   NIH-funded clinical trial shows potential to simplify treatment for early syphilis.

sections.title: Search Press Releases
content: Please use the search field to look for specific words or phrases. You can also “filter” by categories (release type), and topic by clicking on the checkboxes.
